page.title: 15THE VILLAGE OF BILLINGTON
page.content: Billington is a small quiet village about two miles from Leighton Buzzard. There are three parts to the village, Little Billington and Great Billington which is divided into two parts by a main road. There are no shops in Billington therefore the people shop in Leighton Buzzard or Dunstable. A bus goes from the village to Leighton Buzzard on market days which are Tuesdays and Saturdays. The Lions Club also provide a free bus on Thursdays. Local people seem to be farmers or self employed otherwise they commute to work in nearby towns or London which is about 45 minutes away by train from Leighton Buzzard station. There is little to do in the evenings other than visit the local pub, the Greyhound, or go to nearby towns.
